headline: Why Open Text (OTEX) Is Down 14.6% After Naming IBM Veteran Ayman Antoun As Incoming CEO
summary: On January 29, 2026, OpenText announced that veteran technology executive Ayman Antoun will become Chief Executive Officer and join the Board on April 20, 2026, while P. Thomas Jenkins returns to the role of Chair of the Board and James McGourlay moves into the Executive Leadership Team. This leadership shift brings IBM-honed experience in cloud, infrastructure, and enterprise AI into OpenText’s core information management franchise, potentially influencing how the company prioritizes growth...

headline: ORION Security Closes $32 Million in Funding, Ushering in Autonomous Data Loss Prevention without Reliance on Policies
summary: ORION Security, a pioneer in AI-driven contextual data security, today announced that it closed $32 million in funding. The Series A is led by Norwest, with participation from IBM and existing investors PICO Venture Partners, Lama Partners, and others. The round reflects ORION's rapid market penetration with tier-1 global customers, as enterprises are adopting the company's AI-powered platform as an alternative to traditional data loss prevention (DLP) tools.

content.title: ORION Security Closes $32 Million in Funding, Ushering in Autonomous Data Loss Prevention without Reliance on Policies
content.summary: ORION Security, a pioneer in AI-driven contextual data security, today announced that it closed $32 million in funding. The Series A is led by Norwest, with participation from IBM and existing investors PICO Venture Partners, Lama Partners, and others. The round reflects ORION's rapid market penetration with tier-1 global customers, as enterprises are adopting the company's AI-powered platform as an alternative to traditional data loss prevention (DLP) tools.

thumbnail.caption: Orion Security founders Nitay Milner, CEO and Yonatan Kreiner, CTO.

headline: Wall Street Expects Big Things From Advanced Micro Devices’ Earnings Today
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD) reports FY2025 full-year and Q4 earnings on Feb. 3, 2026, after market close. Wall Street is expecting EPS of $1.32 on revenue of approximately $9.6 billion, representing 21% year-over-year (YOY) growth and 25% YOY growth, respectively. Shares have gained 115% over the past year, significantly outpacing the broader technology sector. ... Wall Street Expects Big Things From Advanced Micro Devices’ Earnings Today

headline: Stock Market Today: Nasdaq Gets Hit Hardest As Techs Sink; Palantir Climbs After Earnings (Live Coverage)
summary: Stocks closed Tuesday's session on the losing side with the Nasdaq hit hardest as investors sold tech stocks and sought defensive names while Wall Street read over a slew of quarterly reports.  PayPal crumbled on the stock market today after its earnings report, while blue-chip Walmart hit a market milestone.  The Nasdaq closed with a 1.4% loss.
